title: Test Using Quarto for RevealJS
text:
Embed a Poll Everywhere Activity

The blog post

https://support.polleverywhere.com/hc/en-us/articles/1260801821849-Embed-an-activity


Step 1. Create a poll everywhere activity.
Step 2. Add activities to the RevealJS slides using embed code. See the blog post from slide one.

title: Test Using Quarto for RevealJS
text:
Poll Everywhere Response Link
This slide uses an embedded response link script



Use this link to collect responses even when the activity is not activated. Participants can respond asynchronously or over a long period of time.

title: Test Using Quarto for RevealJS
text:
Poll Everywhere PollEv Page
This slide uses an embedded PollEv page script




Use this page to present an activity to a live audience. The page will always display the activity that is currently activated on the account.
You have to actually go into Poll Everywhere and click the “Activate” button.
Don’t forget to click “Deactivate” when you’re done.

title: Test Using Quarto for RevealJS
text:
Poll Everywhere Live Presentation View
This slide uses an embedded live presentation view script




Share this link to reveal the real-time chart for your activity.
I think this is the view I will typically need to use in class.

title: Test Using Quarto for RevealJS
text:
Sharing slides

You can publish on GitHub. See the Test Quarto Book for Details.
You can share as a PDF file.
You can create a self-contained HTML file by adding the embed-resources: true option to the yaml header.



It seems like the Poll Everywhere questions don’t work if we use the embed-resources: true option.
In fact, it seems like the Poll Everywhere questions don’t work unless I’m actively rendering the document from an RStudio session.
It does seem to work when I publish to GitHub, though.

title: Test Using Quarto for RevealJS
text:
Link to another slide show
Can I use index as a series of links to other slide shows. Why would we do this? Because the Poll Everywhere links do work if we just share the HTML file (even with embed-resources: true). They do work when we serve the slide show from gh-pages, but we don’t want to create a separate repo for each slide show. Therefore, we can link to the slideshows from the index page of the gh-pages branch.

Lab Warm-up: Getting Started

title: Lab Warm-up: Getting Started
text:
Publish error
I’m getting the following errors
ERROR: The specified path (/Users/bradcannell/Library/CloudStorage/Dropbox/Quarto/test_quarto_revealjs) is not a website or book project so cannot be published.
I think I need to change the yaml header to make it a website.
Note This is only because I’m linking between multiple slideshows. Before, when I only had one slideshow, this didn’t happen.
